intro: Lagrezia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered lagrezia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
